page.title: 09TRANSPORT-GALSTON
page.content: Galston has always been closely associated with transport links. The town grew up around a ford and later a bridging point.A meeting place in the centre of town is called the four ways and suggests the town's function as a route centre.This success as a meeting place brought a greater volume of traffic as the strategic A71 route linking North Arshire with the M74 to England and the South.This increased volume of heavy traffic caused great congestion.After great debate a by-pass was built to the North of the town sterilizing the town centre of noise and air pollution:contrary to expectation commercial businesses have not suffered.As the salmon returned to the purified Irvine so the motorist has returned to the centre of the town.The railway linking Kilmarnock to Strathavan was closed in the 60's
